keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER, ALISSA J. RUBIN and LILIA BLAISE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Msaken, and Alissa J. Rubin and Lilia Blaise from Nice, France. Jaber Belkhiria contributed reporting from Msaken.

lead_paragraph: Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who killed 84 people in France, had long displayed a propensity for violence, and his life appears to show how the unstable have latched on to Islamic State propaganda.

headline.print_headline: Killer in Nice Long Drawn to Violence
headline.main: Years Before Truck Rampage in Nice, Attacker Wasn’t ‘Living in the Real World’

snippet: Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who killed 84 people in France, had long displayed a propensity for violence, and his life appears to show how the unstable have latched on to Islamic State propaganda....
abstract: Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who ran over hundreds of people and killed 84 in truck during Bastille Day festivities in Nice, France, showed signs for years of psychosis and penchant for violence; his life seems to demonstrate how unstable and angry people bond to Islamic State propaganda to shape their violent tendencies.
